Shelp.shelp:name: gnumeric.hasSheetArgument
Shelp.shelp:title: Checks if the function expects a .sheet argument.
Shelp.shelp:description: This checks whether the specified function has a parameter named .sheet. This is used internally when creating the call from Gnumeric to the S function.

shelp:argument.shelp:argName:
func
The function object whose argument list is to be checked for the name .sheet. This is not the name of the function, but the function object itself. It is retrieved internally by the internal code that effects the interface from Gnumeric to S.

Shelp.shelp:details: This is used internally and is only documented here so that others might make use of it in generating interfaces programmatically.
Shelp.shelp:value: A logical value indicating whether the list of parameters contains a named element .sheet.
